Description: Chian Sphinx and Lion Style pottery plastic double head, possibly from a kernos or lekanis; two moulded female heads back to back; white slip; black applied eyes, dotted necklaces, and headress; dot pattern frieze around bottom of busts; hollow inside with hole at top.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1388, pl. 178)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2194) (phase 2)
